answers.answer: I have 5 diagnoses that alone make me  live with chrnic, severe pain.  And I have major problems with my digestive tract and I often find myself nauseous and barfing.  There are other complications too.  Like Diabetes. I live a very active life.because of your worsening condition, it is time to start to seek a diagnosis and then treatment options.  I suggest you start with the primary care who can do routine test.  Get copies of thes results and then take them with you.  A neurologist would be a good second step because of the pain, stiffness and other strange feelings in your body parts.  A good neuologist will them run more specific tests.  That will rule out a lot of stuff.  And if you are lucky, may actually figure oput your real diagnosis.  If it is anything under the neurologist's domain, they can do alot of first line pain management treatments. Depending on wwhat you have and how you do, at some point you may need to see a pain manangement specialist.  THe right one can do miracles for you. I know.  Foloowing his directions makes the pain bearable and I CAN FUNCTION most of the time.  It gives me much more life than a life of laying in bed screaming in pain and stiffness.This is what and in what order I suggest.  By all means, get more input, add in your own personal goals and needs and then  implement your plan.  This process takes time and this suggested order is the fastest way I have found to get to the end goals of feeling better and living and doing more.Good luck.

question: Hi!  I am an active 39 year old female.  My problem is that this past year I feel that I am starting to fall apart.  What I mean by this is that I have started to have pain in my shoulder area and a stiff neck (daily).  I take ibuprofin for it and it helps, but never goes away.  Also, I have pain from time to time in my hip area and sometimes the outer side of my left thigh - like a burning/bruise pain.  This past week I started having pain on the right side of my head that feels like an electric shock.  It comes and goes and it is starting to drive me a little crazy.  It's a piercing pain.  And lastly, I started feeling sick to my stomach this week too.  I wake in the middle of the night with nausea - I just keep going back to sleep and then waking up again with the nausea.  In the morning it is gone.  See, I'm falling apart :-)!  Help!
title: I'm falling apart - help!
